p: This work involved genetic, biochemical and physiological studies of a number of enzymes involved in the catabolism of nucleosides and deoxynucleosides in Escherichia coli. Two analogues, azauracil (Azu) and 5-FU were used, and preliminary tests showed that E. coli was significantly more sensitive to 5-FU (sensitive to 0.25 µg ml −1) than Azu (requiring 100 µg ml −1) to kill equivalent concentration of the bacteria.
